content:
Thoughts on this widget? It's being merged soon, and I'm uncertain about both the string content and also the threshhold at which it should fire (currently in the code it's 100, decreased for my dev environment so I could make this screenshot).

pasted image

The goal here is to... make people think twice before subscribing a lot of folks to a new stream? Or to prevent people from accidentally subscribing a big group when they didn't mean to? Is there any kind of recommendation to users so they know whether this unusual/bad/discouraged/dangerous?

OK. So it's not a warning about something bad...

I might embed the number in the title ("130 subscribers!" instead of "Large number of subscribers") and simplify the language inside and provide some more decision-related context (e.g. something like "Are you sure you want to create stream 'abc' with 130 subscribers? Tip: instead, you might want to go back and use the 'announce stream' feature to make it easy for users to discover and join stream 'abc' according to their interest.").
I feel like the cool kids would say "That's a lot of subscribers!".
It's true. Zulip doesn't totally go in for this playful vibe though (yet?).

I would prefer all of these to "Large number of subscribers":

  • 130 subscribers!
  • That's a lot of subscribers! (followed by gentle/humorous text)
  • Before you proceed...
  • You are about to subscribe lots of people. (followed by clinical/professional description of the consequences)
  • Confirmation
  • Subscribe users
@Josh Mandel yes and no -- https://chat.zulip.org/api/
https://zulipchat.com/apps/ is also a "good one"

Do we have apps? Appsolutely.
Ok, I take it back, I'm sorry, please don't go.
Haha! Yeah, the docs are more playful, it's true.

All kidding aside, I think for don't-screw-up modals, you have to commit to warning people that they are about to possibly do something wrong, and phrase it as clearly and succinctly as possible.

Please confirm

You are about to subscribe 101 people to this stream. They will all receive welcome messages and have the stream added to their sidebar. Do you wish to continue?

That's a lot of subscribers! (followed by gentle/humorous text)

I am mildly dubious of something like that? At least, I always thought Doodle's "that's a lot of timeslots" or whatever message was a little weird... scheduling for people in student groups with me tended to go way over the threshold, and I'm suspicious that we might get some similar "eh, that's not so many" thoughts... I like Josh's 10:57pm proposal.
Describing the consequences (Steve's proposal) sounds like a good idea.
